item.title: Policeman’s body recovered in Ctg, APBn suspects suicide
item.description: Members of the Armed Police Battalion (APBn) believe that a policeman whose body was recovered in Chattogram died by suicide. Deepak Jyoti Khisha, superintendent of police for RAB-9, said law enforcers initially suspect that 25-year-old Nayeem Biswas hanged himself. The cause of death will be conf

item.title: Orangutans at risk as Indonesia floods devastate habitat
item.description: Before the deadly landslides and floods hit Indonesia about two weeks ago, Amran Siagian, 39, frequently met Tapanuli orangutans on a hill in the region of Sipirok, North Sumatra province. Siagian, who has been working as a ranger to protect the endangered animal at the Orangutan Information Cente

item.title: US Justice Department accuses two Chinese men of trying to smuggle Nvidia chips
item.description: Two Chinese men are in custody for allegedly smuggling Nvidia H100 and H200 chips to China, the US Justice Department said on Monday, as President Donald Trump gave the green light for Nvidia to export its H200 chips to Beijing. Prosecutors allege that Fanyue Gong, 43, a Chinese citizen living in

item.title: India orders crisis-hit IndiGo to cut flights by 5%
item.description: India's aviation regulator has ordered crisis-hit IndiGo to cut its number of planned flights by 5 percent to stabilise its operations. In a notice dated on Monday but disclosed on Tuesday, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation asked IndiGo to submit a revised schedule by Wednesday.

item.title: Global pilots warn India's rest rule exemption for IndiGo raises safety concerns
item.description: India's decision to ease stricter rules on pilot rest following a wave of flight cancellations by the country's largest carrier should be reversed due to the adverse effect of fatigue on safety, the head of global pilot union group IFALPA said. IndiGo, which controls about 65 percent of India's do

item.title: Constable accused of beating Barishal journalist with hammer
item.description: A police constable has been accused of entering a flat in Barishal and beating Asian TV's Barishal bureau chief, Firoz Mostafa, with a hammer. The incident took place on Monday night at his rented home on Gorachand Das Road, according to Barishal Kotwali Model Police Station chief (OC) Al Mamun Ul

item.title: RMG factory closure sparks protests in Gazipur
item.description: Workers of a garment factory staged a demonstration in front of PN Composite Ltd at Ambagh in Konabari, Gazipur on Tuesday, protesting the sudden closure of the factory. “The authorities hung a closure notice on the main gate on Monday evening. When workers arrived for duty on Tuesday mornin

item.title: Woman killed in road crash on Dhaka-Mawa Expressway
item.description: A 50-year-old woman was killed and three others injured when a microbus crashed into an auto-rickshaw on the Dhaka-Mawa Expressway at Ompara in Sreenagar upazila of Munshiganj district on Tuesday. The deceased was identified as Zobaida Begum, wife of Ekhlas Uddin of Baroikhali Shibrampur are

item.title: Mobile technology fuels AI adoption in Bangladesh, Telenor Asia study finds
item.description: Mobile phones are at the heart of Bangladesh’s digital transformation, from accessing online learning and financial services to managing daily tasks and staying informed, according to the latest Telenor Asia study. Increasingly, these everyday conveniences are powered by artificial intellige

item.title: NBR chief calls for expanded VAT registration to cut reliance on imports
item.description: National Board of Revenue (NBR) Chairman Md Abdur Rahman Khan on Tuesday underscored the urgent need to expand the country’s VAT and income tax base to reduce reliance on import-based revenue, strengthen fiscal stability, and support Bangladesh’s development ambitions. “Developme

item.title: NBR to develop automated system linking return submission with banks: Chairman
item.description: National Board of Revenue (NBR) Chairman Md Abdur Rahman Khan on Tuesday said the revenue authority is developing an automated system that will integrate taxpayers’ annual return submission with banks. It will ease eliminate the need for individuals to collect multiple bank certificates from

item.title: Accused escapes stabbing CID official in Sylhet
item.description: An accused in a Cybercrime case fled the police custody after stabbing an officer of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) at Sagardighi Par in Sylhet city on Monday midnight. The victim, Khurshed Alam, a sub-inspector of CID, was admitted to Osmani Medical College and Hospital. Sugya
